TEXT.TITLE: CONTINENTAL BANK INITIAL DISTRIBUTION APPROVED
TEXT.BODY:
Continental Bank of Canada said shareholders approved a capital reorganization to allow an initial payout by the end of May to common shareholders from last year's 200 mln Canadian dlr sale of most Continental assets to <Lloyds Bank PLC>'s Lloyds Bank Canada. The bank said the initial distribution would take the form of a stock dividend of cumulative redeemable retractable class A series two preferred shares entitling holders to monthly floating rate dividends at 72 pct of prime and to 12.75 dlrs a share on retraction. Continental said the initial payout was subject to Canadian government approval. The bank reiterated that total distributions to common shareholders would range from 16.50 dlrs a share to 17.25 dlrs including the initial stock dividend and a final distribution in late 1988 or early 1989. The payout of existing preferred shareholders will be completed just before next month's initial distribution to common shareholders, Continental added.
